properties.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued January 22 at 11:14PM PST until January 23 at 3:00PM PST by NWS Portland OR
properties.description:
* WHAT...Tidal overflow flooding expected. Total tide near 11 to
11.5 ft.

* WHERE...Along low-lying parts of the south Washington Coast.

* WHEN...From 9 AM to 3 PM PST Thursday around high tide.

* IMPACTS...Minor flooding, up to 1 ft above ground level, during
high tides is expected in the low lying areas near bays,
sloughs, and the lower reaches of the coastal rivers.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...In southwest Washington similar conditions
in the past have resulted in minor flooding in Raymond, on HWY
101 near South Bend, and/or minor erosion of HWY 105 near North
Cove.
properties.instruction:
A Coastal Flood Advisory means that tidal overflow flooding is
expected. Coastal residents in the warned area should be alert
for rising water, and take appropriate action to protect life and
property.

NWSheadline: COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM TO 3 PM PST THURSDAY FOR MINOR TIDAL OVERFLOW ALONG LOW LYING SECTIONS OF THE SOUTHWEST WASHINGTON COAST
